document_name: Institutional Strengthening and Support to the Ministry of Health prodoc.pdf
http://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/documents/projects/TTO/00015001/Institutional Strengthening and Support to the Ministry of Health prodoc.pdf

outputs.output_descr:
The project is part of a broader strategy of the Ministry of Health to address persisting shortage of health professionals to work in the national public health service. Launched in 2003, the main goal of the project is to  strengthen the capacity of health institutions throughout Trinidad and Tobago to deliver better health care and medical services to the communities they serve. In partnership with  UNDP and the United Nations Volunteers Programme, the project has placed 100+ foreign medical doctors in Trinidad  and Tobago. 
  
Project outcomes included:
1)  Improved efficiency and equity in the provision of heath care services to the publlic of Trinidad and Tobago through the provision of specialized medical professionals from the United Nations Volunteer Programme building capacity of local professionals through the hosting of workshops and mentorship programme.
2) Promotion of the UN Volunteer ethic to encourage community service, outreach and committed actions for the public good.

project_descr: Institutional Strengthening and Support to the Ministry of Health
